title.narrative: Pilot purification plant for landfill percolation water in China

description.narrative: • Short general project overviewThe environmentally oriented use of landfills is essential to prevent emissions of unwanted components to surface water and groundwater. Cool Separations' innovative EFC solution makes it possible to separate percolation water contaminated with salts cost-effectively and energy efficiently and to work it up into pure water and usable salts.In most landfills in China, landfill percolation water still disappears into the soil and/or in surface water, contributing to the total pollution in, for example, the Yangtze Delta. If we can roll out our EFC solution across all landfill sites in this delta, this form of large-scale pollution will come to an end based on a cost-effective business case: with one full-scale capacity EFC facility, approximately 100,000 cubic metres of clean water can be produced per year. The EFC facility is considerably more energy efficient than the current practice of incineration or evaporation of landfill wastewater. In China, there is a market for more than 500 of these plants.The aim of this WWSD pilot project is the development, construction and practical operation of a successful pilot on a 10% scale of the final full-scale EFC facility, which allows landfill percolation water to be separated and reprocessed into pure water and usable salts.The results envisaged in this pilot project are:- A well-functioning EFC pilot plant.- A report on the functioning of the EFC process of cost-effectively separating and updating landfill percolation water.- A validation report of the business case for WCET for a GO decision for the construction of full-scale facilities.This should provide the pilot site operator with enough evidence to enable an investment in three full-scale installations.
